text:
As far as Chinese food goes, this is one of those places that are slightly over the quality of a buffet. A little too salty and a little too sweet perhaps, but that's what you'd expect from such a place. The decor is almost non-existant but at least it's not kitch or lame. 

I do pick up here a couple of times a week, but honestly I don't know what they clean their tables with but they're always sticky and fairly disgusting, at least near the door, so I tend to not eat in the dining room.

Prices are fair, you'll pay on average 10$ for a plate and they have cheap combos with rice and soggy chop suey, like you would expect.
Their general tao was satisfactory, but their fried rice seemed to need some improvement.
Bon, pas chere mais pas traditionnel,  plus faste food commercial.  Ça fait la job dans le quartier, quand t'as le goût d'un Pad thai ou d'un poulet général Tao.

Bon, depuis que j'habite Hochelaga je chiale qu'il n'y a pas assez de Resto pour le take out. Donc plutôt que de chialer j'ai décidé, avec beaucoup de doutes, d'essayer des places comme le Dragon magnifique. Je dois admettre que le pad thaï aux crevettes, à 10$, est bon. Bien relevé, énorme, pas cheap sur les crevettes. Ce n'est pas un endroit où j'irais manger en salle par contre: pas joli et intense odeur de friture. Mais pour du take et quand j'aurai envie de manger du fast good chinois, j'y retournerai.
